title: Charlie Kirk murder: Shooter caught on cam? FBI releases photos of 'person of interest'
content: The FBI has released the first photos of the alleged assassin of Charlie Kirk. They are seeking public assistance in identifying the person. Kirk, the CEO of Turning Point USA, was shot while addressing students at Utah Valley University. Tributes have poured in from figures like Donald Trump and Barack Obama. Flags will be flown at half-staff.

title: 'India is one of top relationships': Rubio on ties; backs Sergio Gor
content: US State Secretary Marco Rubio emphasized the paramount importance of the US-India relationship, highlighting it as a top priority for America's future. He introduced Sergio Gor, the US ambassador-designate to India, noting Gor's close ties to President Trump.

title: ‚ÄòWill sort out with India‚Äô: Trump official confident of deal; ‚Äòstop Russia oil buys‚Äô
content: Amid ongoing trade negotiations between India and the US, optimism is growing, with US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick expressing confidence in reaching an agreement if India liberalizes its markets and ceases Russian oil imports.

title: Asia Cup: 'Play hard, play fair' - Rahane hails Surya‚Äôs sportsmanship
content: India's Asia Cup 2025 began with a dominant win over UAE, but Suryakumar Yadav's sportsmanship stole the show. He withdrew a run-out appeal, earning praise from Ajinkya Rahane, who highlighted the gesture's significance. Rahane also commented on team balance, noting Arshdeep Singh's absence and suggesting his inclusion alongside Bumrah for quality pace bowling against stronger opponents later in the tournament.

title: Elon Musk reacts to assassination of Donald Trump's key aide Charlie Kirk
content: Right-wing activist Charlie Kirk was reportedly shot dead in a targeted attack at Utah Valley University, prompting strong reactions. Elon Musk condemned the act as a "cold-blooded murder," criticizing those celebrating the incident and accusing the left of promoting violence.

title: 'Male, college-aged': FBI briefs on Kirk‚Äôs assassin; what we know about the shooter
content: Authorities are actively searching for the gunman responsible for the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk, a prominent ally of Donald Trump, during a campus event at Utah Valley University. The attack, which Utah's governor has condemned as a political assassination, prompted a lockdown of the university as investigators scour for evidence. President Trump has vowed to find those responsible for the tragedy.

title: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison edges toward richest-person title once again
content: Oracle's stock experienced a slight dip after a record surge, fueled by its booming AI cloud business. This surge briefly propelled co-founder Larry Ellison past Elon Musk as the world's richest person, with his net worth soaring by nearly $100 billion. OpenAI's massive $300 billion agreement with Oracle for computing power significantly contributed to this growth.

title: 'I am here again': Rohit Sharma shows readiness in energetic net session ‚Äì Watch
content: Rohit Sharma is gearing up for the ODI series against Australia, marking his return to international cricket after seven months. He shared a video of his net session, showcasing his form and fitness. Recent concerns arose from a hospital visit, but he has since cleared a fitness test.

title: PM to visit Manipur on September 13, will unveil projects worth Rs 8,500 crore
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to visit Manipur on September 13, marking his first visit since the ethnic clashes began in May. He will launch development projects worth Rs 8,500 crore, laying foundation stones in Churachandpur, a Kuki-majority area, and inaugurating projects from Imphal.

title: Guns of delusion: Who killed Charlie Kirk? America‚Äôs Second Amendment obstinacy
content: ‚ÄãYeats asked us to cast a cold eye on life and death. America prays, drowning in grief after every incident, but refuses to accept the simple truth: fewer guns will mean fewer deaths. That arithmetic is too much for a nation addicted to tragedy. Kirk had once argued that American campuses were no longer safe for people who held non-liberal views. He was right, when it came to debate. But it ‚Äãwas the nation‚Äôs obstinacy that ultimately took a bright young man‚Äôs life. And in any sane nation, that shouldn‚Äôt be worth it.

title: Gemini app tops 10M users: Nano Banana fuels buzz; viral prompts to try
content: Google's Gemini app, featuring the AI image editing tool Nano Banana, has achieved over 10 million downloads shortly after its launch. Users have already created or modified over 200 million images, leveraging Nano Banana's speed and accuracy. Viral trends showcase the tool's versatility, allowing users to transform themselves into action figures, appear in different decades, and step into famous artworks.

title: Gold prices hit all-time high of Rs 1,13,100 per 10g in Delhi, up 43% this year;
content: Gold prices in the national capital reached an all-time high of Rs 1,13,100 per 10 grams, driven by sustained buying and global uncertainties. The precious metal has surged over 40% this year, fueled by central bank activity and geopolitical tensions. Silver prices, however, experienced a slight dip, while investors globally await the US Federal Reserve's policy meeting.

title: Asia Cup: Pak coach makes bold claim ahead of India clash - 'Surface irrelevant'
content: Pakistan team is gearing up for the Asia Cup, with head coach Mike Hesson emphasising the strength of their spin attack, particularly Mohammad Nawaz, ahead of their crucial match against India. Hesson highlighted the depth in Pakistan's spin options, suggesting they could be a defining factor given the UAE's slow pitches.

title: NFL stars mourn Charlie Kirk; Butker leads tributes; Utah death shocks league
content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk tragically died after being shot at Utah Valley University, sparking widespread reactions. NFL players like Harrison Butker and Jaxson Dart, along with media members, expressed grief and called for an end to political violence. The shocking event united athletes, fans, and media in mourning, highlighting the need for unity and peace.

title: Deebo Samuel vs Packers: will he play?; Commanders injury update latest
content: Will Washington Commanders wide receiver Deebo Samuel play against the Green Bay Packers tonight? Get the latest injury update, full game details, kickoff time, and streaming info for Thursday Night Football at Lambeau Field. Find out Samuel‚Äôs status, why he‚Äôs key to Jayden Daniels‚Äô offense, and how his trade from the 49ers changed Washington‚Äôs attack.

title: Watch: Haunting moment Charlie Kirk said 'some gun deaths are worth it'
content: At 31, his career ended in the most violent way possible. A sniper‚Äôs bullet struck him in the neck as he spoke to students at Utah Valley University. The rally turned into chaos. Within hours, Kirk was gone.

title: Sachin to be next BCCI Prez? Legendary batter breaks silence: 'We wish to ...'
content: Sachin Tendulkar's management has refuted rumours linking the cricket legend to the BCCI president's position. With the BCCI's AGM approaching on September 28 and the president's post vacant after Roger Binny's exit, speculation had been rampant. However, SRT Sports Management clarified that Tendulkar is not being considered for the role.

title: Charlie Kirk killing: Assassin caught on cam? Shadowy figure seen on rooftop
content: Chilling footage has emerged, purportedly showing the assassin who fatally shot Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University. The video captures a dark figure on a rooftop moments after the shooting, as chaos erupted among the 3,000 attendees. Authorities are investigating the footage and searching for the rooftop shooter after Kirk was pronounced dead minutes later.

title: Gen Z group, army discuss roadmap for provisional government- Who will be interim PM
content: Following Prime Minister Oli's resignation amid protests, Gen Z protesters are in talks with Nepal's President and Army Chief to form an interim government. Chief Justice Sushila Karki, Kathmandu Mayor Balendra Shah, and others are being considered to lead the caretaker government, tasked with overseeing fresh elections. Discussions continue to navigate the political transition and maintain order.

title: Sonia Gandhi voter roll row: Delhi court dismisses plea seeking action
content: A Delhi court has dismissed a plea seeking action against Congress leader Sonia Gandhi over allegations regarding her inclusion in the electoral rolls before she became an Indian citizen. The complainant, Vikas Tripathi, argued that Gandhi's name was added to the New Delhi constituency's voter list in 1980, prior to her citizenship in 1983.

title: Shah Rukh Khan, Vikrant Massey to attend National Film Awards: Top 5 entertainment news
content: The 71st National Film Awards ceremony in New Delhi is set to honor talents like Shah Rukh Khan and Vikrant Massey. Karisma Kapoor's lawyer dismisses the Rs 30,000 crore estate figure as a 'media creation' amid an inheritance dispute. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan secured a ban on unauthorized use of her name and image.

title: IND vs PAK: Ex-Pakistan captain reveals why buzz is missing ‚Äì 'No hype'
content: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif suggested India's easy agreement to play Pakistan in the Asia Cup has diminished the usual excitement surrounding the match. He contrasted this with past encounters where obstacles heightened anticipation, noting high ticket prices as a contributing factor to the subdued build-up. Despite this, he anticipated the match would gain momentum closer to the date.

title: Justin Jefferson‚Äôs chain giveaway: Fan moment goes viral; 'Griddy Boy' regret
content: Justin Jefferson, the Minnesota Vikings' wide receiver, gifted his 'TOP 10' chain to a young fan after defeating the Chicago Bears, sparking heartwarming reactions. While many praised Jefferson's generosity and the unforgettable moment for the child, some fans expressed concerns about the chain's value and the athlete's financial future, highlighting contrasting perspectives on the gesture.

title: Manipur: 43 BJP members quit in Phungyar, days before PM Modi‚Äôs likely visit
content: Ahead of Prime Minister Modi's anticipated visit to Manipur, 43 BJP members in Ukhrul district resigned, citing a lack of inclusiveness and respect for grassroots leadership. This mass resignation occurs against the backdrop of ongoing ethnic tensions between Meitei and Kuki-Zo communities.

title: IND vs PAK tickets: ECB denies sluggish sales; says response encouraging
content: The Emirates Cricket Board (ECB) dismissed reports of sluggish India-Pakistan ticket sales, confirming strong demand. An ECB official said 3,000 Platinum List tickets released online sold out within minutes, underlining the massive fan interest for Sunday‚Äôs high-stakes Dubai clash.

title: MNS warns Kapil Sharma: Mumbai should not be called Bombay or Bambai
content: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has cautioned comedian Kapil Sharma against referring to Mumbai as 'Bombay' or 'Bambai' on his Netflix show, 'The Great Indian Kapil Show.' MNS leader Ameya Khopkar warned of potential strong agitation if the city's name isn't properly addressed.

title: UK PM removes Mandelson as US ambassador over fresh Epstein revelations
content: UK Prime Minister ousted Peter Mandelson as Ambassador to the US after emails revealed a deeper relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence suggested Mandelson defended Epstein's initial conviction, a stance undisclosed during his appointment. The sacking followed reports by The Sun and Bloomberg detailing supportive messages sent to Epstein during a 2008 investigation.

title: Vanessa Bryant steps up: fulfills godmother role; sends birthday wishes to Ellie
content: Vanessa Bryant celebrated Pau Gasol's daughter Ellie's 5th birthday with a heartfelt Instagram story, showcasing the enduring bond between the two families. Gasol, touched by the gesture, praised Vanessa as the "Best God Mother!" Their connection, forged during their time with the Lakers, has deepened over the years, with Gasol now a pillar of support for the Bryant family.

title: Dwyane Wade‚Äôs wife Gabrielle Union: craving wild nights; couple sings, grooves
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union were spotted enjoying a lively night out with friends, filled with karaoke, singing, and dancing. Union shared glimpses of their fun-filled evening on Instagram, expressing her desire for more such moments. The couple, who recently celebrated their 11th anniversary, were seen attending a football match before heading to the after-party.

title: Karisma legal battle: Lawyer calls Rs 30,000 cr estate claim 'media fabrication'
content: The battle over late Sunjay Kapur's wealth escalates. His children and mother challenge the will. They allege forgery by his widow, Priya Sachdeva Kapur. Sunjay's sister, Mandhira Kapur Smith, supports the children. She questions the will's validity. Karisma Kapoor's lawyer clarifies the focus is on securing the children's inheritance. The family disputes the reported estate value.

title: 200 flyers left sweating on Singapore-bound Air India flight; stranded inside for 2hrs
content: Over 200 passengers on an Air India flight to Singapore faced a distressing ordeal at Delhi airport. Due to malfunctioning air conditioning and electrical systems on Wednesday night, passengers were stuck inside the Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner for nearly two hours. The discomfort led to passengers using newspapers as fans before being deplaned.

title: 'Never understand USA': Faf baffled after Kirk's assassination; 'can have a gun'
content: Political activist Charlie Kirk was fatally shot at Utah Valley University during his comeback tour, prompting a widespread search for the shooter. The incident has sparked reactions, including from Donald Trump, who lamented it as a "dark moment." Ex South Africa skipper Faf du Plessis voiced concerns about American gun laws.

title: 'Multiple active crime scenes': Who killed Charlie Kirk? Police widen search for sniper
content: Charlie Kirk was fatally shot while addressing a crowd at Utah Valley University, prompting an intense manhunt for the rooftop sniper. The conservative activist was answering questions about gun violence when the incident occurred, leading to a campus lockdown. Authorities are actively investigating multiple crime scenes and have questioned, then released, two individuals initially detained.

title: HDFC: Multiple services to be unavailable for several hours on September 13 - check details
content: HDFC Bank will conduct scheduled maintenance on September 13th, 2025, from 12:30 AM to 7:30 AM IST to enhance system performance. During this period, NetBanking, MobileBanking, UPI services, and some ATM/debit card functionalities will be unavailable. Customers are advised to use PayZapp Wallet for uninterrupted payments, while credit card services will remain largely operational.

title: Aishwarya Rai personality rights case: HC orders takedown of unauthorized content featuring actor
content: The Delhi High Court has granted Aishwarya Rai Bachchan interim relief in a case concerning the unauthorized use of her name, image, and persona on digital platforms, including AI-generated content. The court directed platforms, e-commerce sites, and Google to remove infringing content and block specified URLs within 72 hours. Read on.

title: Three-month-long Champions Boat League to begin on September 19
content: The 2025 edition will feature 14 races in as many places. Inaugural race will be at the Pampa in Kainakary in Alappuzha district while the finals will be at Ashtamudi Lake in Kollam on December 6

content: Accommodation bookings across 56 destinations rose 19% in FY24; premiumisation and group travel gaining ground

title: Akola riots 2023 case | Police officers must shed communal colours when they put on their uniforms, says Supreme Court
content: The top court directs action against police who ignored a teenage Muslim assault victim and eyewitness to murder during the 2023 Akola communal riots and orders probe by SIT comprising Muslim and Hindu officers

title: SIET to organise Aksharakoottu literary festival for children
content: On Kanakakkunnu Palace premises on September 18 and 19.  Festival intended to encourage students with an interest in literary pursuits and give them an insight into literature and language

content: Heart of braindead restaurateur from Kottarakara transplanted into Angamaly native and his kidneys, liver and corneas have also been donated

title: Postal ballots for NRI voters may turn a reality soon
content: Chief Electoral Officer, Kerala, Rathan U. Kelkar says his office has urged the ECI to introduce the facility for the upcoming 2026 Assembly elections in the State

title: Rajnath Singh flags off ‚ÄòSamudra Pradakshina‚Äô, world‚Äôs first tri-service all-women circumnavigation sailing expedition
content: According to Ministry of Defence, over the next nine months, 10 women officers from the Army, Navy and Air Force will sail onboard the indigenously-built Indian Army Sailing Vessel (IASV) Triveni

title: Wayanad chamber to seek Priyanka‚Äôs support for cable car project, bypasses
content: The MP is expected to visit the site of the proposed Padinjarathara-Poozhithode bypass on September 12, 2025

title: Pig farms in Thiruvananthapuram found burying large amounts of waste on their premises
content: In April, the Kerala State Commission for Protection of Child Rights has directed the authorities of three grama panchayats in the district to close down pig farms functioning without valid licences in unhygienic surroundings and causing pollution

title: National conference of gynaec surgeons in Thrissur
content: Three-day SOVSICON-25 to bring together 500 doctors. Workshops on vaginal surgery and cosmetic gynaecology to be held

title: Fete to celebrate quality and excellence in higher education
content: Excellencia 2025, scheduled to be held on September 15, 16 in Thiruvananthapuram, will honour top institutions, devise strategies to improve quality of education ¬†

title: Veteran Congress leader and former Speaker P.P. Thankachan passes away
content: His passing at 87 brings the curtains down on a momentous political career that spanned almost five decades.

title: Ahead of elections, BJP steps up engagement with Christian community
content: Outreach with all communities, including Christians, will be expanded to the grassroots level  ahead of the upcoming elections. Committees will be formed at both the Assembly and panchayat levels to enable this,  says  Shone George, BJP State vice-president

title: Army conducts drone integration exercise in tactical ops during Exercise Siyom Prahar
content: Three-day field training drill tested unmanned aerial systems for surveillance, targeting and precision strikes

title: Kerala has become entrepreneurial hub, says Industries Minister
content: District Industries Centre organised the investor meet in collaboration with industrialists who participated in the Invest Kerala Global Summit held in Kochi and are investing over ‚Çπ20 crore in Malappuram

title: FBI Releases Pic Of 'Person Of Interest' In Charlie Kirk Killing, Rifle Found
content: Charlie Kirk, conservative activist and close ally of US President Donald Trump was assassinated on Wednesday.

title: Siblings Show Bihar Women Mushroom Dreams, Dupe Them Of Rs 2 Crore
content: A case has been registered in Bihar's Muzaffarpur district against a company for allegedly siphoning off nearly Rs 1.9 crore from loans sanctioned in the names of 100 rural women enrolled in the government's livelihood programme.

title: Not Far Apart On Trade Deal With India: Trump's Ambassador Pick At US Senate
content: US President Donald Trump's nominee for the country's ambassador to India, Sergio Gor, has said that Washington and New Delhi are not "that far apart right now" on the trade deal.

title: Trump Aide Navarro Tried To Start Fight Between Him, PM Modi: Ex US NSA
content: Peter Navarro, the trade advisor of Donald Trump, had once tried to start a fight between the US President and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, John Bolton, the former National Security Advisor of the US, told NDTV today.

title: After Mass Nepal Prison Break, 1 Inmate Knocks To Get Back In. Here's Why
content: At least 15,000 prisoners escaped from more than two dozen prisons across Nepal after mass jailbreaks as Gen-Z protestors took to the streets to protest against corruption and the government's ban on several social media apps

title: Politics On Field: Trinamool, BJP Organise Football Tournaments In West Bengal
content: With West Bengal scheduled to witness Assembly polls next year, the games being played are literally on field with the Trinamool Congress organising the Swami Vivekananda Cup and the BJP holding the Narendra Cup.

title: Top Court Reserves Verdict On Pleas Asking Bengal To Pay 25% Of Pending Dues
content: The Supreme Court on Monday reserved its verdict on pleas, including the one filed by the West Bengal government against the Calcutta High Court 2022 order, asking the state to release Dearness Allowance (DA) arrears since July 2009.

title: 2 Police Officers Killed, 1 Missing As Car Falls Into Madhya Pradesh River
content: At least three police officers, including Unhel police station in-charge Ashok Sharma, drowned after their car fell into the Shipra River in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Saturday.

title: South Korea Overturns 61-Year Ruling On Woman's Self-Defence Case
content: A South Korean court acquitted on Wednesday a woman convicted six decades ago for defending herself against sexual violence, after she challenged the ruling inspired by the country's #MeToo movement.

title: SpiceJet Flight To Kathmandu Faces Suspected Tailpipe Fire, Returns To Bay
content: SpiceJet's Kathmandu-bound plane faced a suspected tailpipe fire at the Delhi airport on Thursday and returned to the bay.

title: Army Successfully Conducts Exercise Siyom Prahar, Validates Drone Tactics
content: The Indian Army successfully conducted Exercise Siyom Prahar from September 8 to 10, a major field training exercise aimed at validating the employment of drone technology in modern tactical operations.

title: Trump To Award Charlie Kirk Presidential Medal of Freedom, US' Highest Honour
content: US President Donald Trump announced on Thursday that he will posthumously award right-wing activist Charlie Kirk, the highest civilian honour - the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

title: Charlie Kirk Assassination Updates: Trump Ally Charlie Kirk's Assassin Still At Large, Manhunt Underway
content: Charlie Kirk Assassination Updates: Charlie Kirk, a conservative activist and close ally of US President Donald Trump, was shot dead at a Utah college event.

title: Nepal Protest LIVE Updates: Curfew Imposed In Kathmandu Again After 2-Hour Lift Amid Protests
content: Nepal Protest LIVE: Nepal remained under nationwide restrictive orders and curfew on Thursday after deadly 'Gen-z' protests rocked the small Himalayan nation earlier this week.

title: Tamil Nadu To Challenge Supreme Court's Exam Deadline For Teachers
content: The Tamil Nadu government has decided to move the Supreme Court with a Review Petition against its recent judgment mandating that all in-service teachers without the Teacher Eligibility Test (TET) qualification must clear it within two years.

title: Amritsar Temple Grenade Attack Case: Probe Agency NIA Recovers Grenades, Pistols
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has recovered three hand grenades and a pistol in the Amritsar temple grenade attack case, exposing the transnational terror conspiracy involving a major arms and explosives syndicate, the agency said.

title: Vice President CP Radhakrishnan To Take Oath On September 12 In Delhi
content: The oath-taking ceremony of Vice President-elect Chandrapuram Ponnusamy Radhakrishnan is scheduled for the morning of September 12, Friday, at Rashtrapati Bhawan in New Delhi.

title: Israel's Chief Economist "Very Excited" About Adani Group's Haifa Port
content: Israel's Chief Economist Shmuel Abramzon has described the Adani Group's Haifa Port as one of the most significant foreign investments in recent years, welcoming India's growing role in Israel's infrastructure and industrial sectors.

title: Bengaluru's Shivajinagar Metro To Be Named St Mary? Siddaramaiah Sparks Row
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's assurance to rename an upcoming metro station in Bengaluru's Shivaji Nagara after St Mary has sparked a massive row, with the BJP accusing the Congress government of insulting the Maratha icon

title: KILA to groom women leaders for 2025 local body polls
content: The three-day training programme, exclusively for women aspiring to contest, aims at building their leadership, communication, and governance skills

content: In this video, let‚Äôs see how Amit Shah‚Äôs Tamil Nadu strategy is in trouble. Allies TTV Dhinakaran and O. Panneerselvam have walked out. The AIADMK is facing internal trouble, the PMK at war with itself. As the NDA unravels ahead of the 2026 elections, can Shah steady the ship?

title: Do not play into hands of those bent on tarnishing Tirumala image, says TTD Chairman B.R. Naidu urges media
content: He stresses the need to exercise caution before becoming the medium for negative publicity against the TTD

title: Court will not sit idle if a wing of democracy fails to discharge its duties: Supreme Court
content: SC reserves Presidential Reference for judgment; ‚ÄòWe cannot ask a Governor to take a decision in a particular manner, but the court can very well ask the Governor to take a decision,‚Äô says the court

title: Police review progress of probe into synthetic drug trafficking cases involving foreign nationals
content: Primary findings suggest suspects have set up operational bases outside Kerala to coordinate distribution, say Anti-Narcotics Squad

title: State, TDB must ensure Global Ayyappa Sangamam does not affect sanctity of Sabarimala temple, Pampa: Kerala HC
content: The court ordered that the event must not disrupt devotees‚Äô access to the temple, while ensuring that the sanctity of the Pampa river and the temple premises is preserved.

title: Studies sought on amoebic density in waterbodies in Kerala
content: Primary amoebic meningoencephalitis and granulomatous amoebic encephalitis are the two types of commonly found infections caused by the free-living amoeba

title: Smart rice card corrections can be requested till Oct. 31, says Minister¬†
content: Cards will be deactivated if unused for three consecutive months, reactivation is possible upon a request and after verification, informs Nadendla Manohar

title: KC(M) opposes nationwide special intensive revision of electoral rolls
content: A total of 65 lakh voters lost their voting rights due to the revision of voters‚Äô list in Bihar. The case regarding this is still pending in the Supreme Court. The Commission‚Äôs move to drastically revise the voters‚Äô list in all States before the final verdict is a challenge to the legal system, says Jose K. Mani

title: V-C panel nominee for CU: meeting inconclusive

title: Keralites stranded in Nepal to reach home from Friday
content: With tension easing in many parts of Nepal and air services being resumed, the stranded tourists are likely to return on their own

title: Jaleel-Firos feud escalates as both trade fraud charges

title: Now, immigration clearance in 30 seconds at Thiruvananthapuram airport
